item.title: Projects
item.description: I am currently working on my first personal project. Please check back later for updates.

item.title: Resources
item.description: Some of my favorite resources for learning about cybersecurity and practicing skills Hands-On Hacking TryHackMe Hack the Box VulnHub Over the Wire: Wargames Online Courses EdX Basic Network and Database Security Cybrary Youtubers Null Byte Network Chuck Papers NIST Framework News CSO Online Dark Reading Misc. Map of Cybersecurity Domains MITRE ATT&CK

item.title: Study Space Reviews
item.description: Some of my favorite study spots Render Coffee; Columbus Ave, Boston Very sweet chai lattes. The main attraction is the sunroom at the back, which fills up quickly. Feel surrounded by the outdoors while cozily doing work indoors. I’d like to return when it’s rainy.

item.title: Welcome,
item.description: My name is Shannon and I am currently studying cybersecurity at Northeastern University. Here you’ll find a collection of my personal projects, cyber resources I have found useful, and brief reviews of my favorite coffee shops and libraries to study in. Academic Interests Broadly, my current interests lie in: Cyber operational planning Threat analysis Incident response As I further explore different fields within cybersecurity, I anticipate these interests to be refined.
